title: (Patch 6.9) Seven years later.
body:
> Annie
> W - Incinerate
> RANGE 560 ⇒ 625
> HEAT WAVE **Fixed a bug** where units would be hit if they had escaped the area after the cast 

It was a bug.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ztVMib1T4T4

---

Discuss!

replies.body: Apologies, that's a poor choice of wording in the patch notes that shouldn't have been used. Leaving Annie's W so that it picked its targets at cast start and affected them at cast end was a deliberate choice for a long period of time, not a bug. We shouldn't be describing it as one as a result and should instead be talking about why how we feel it's appropriate to remove some reliability from Annie.

So that's just cho'gath left right?

When do you plan on making this deceptive gameplay flaw gone?

no, if chogath screams and you're in range at the time of the ability, you should be effected. congrats on flashing out soon after but sound travels pretty fast, especially at close quarters. the silence is supposed to act as an intimidation, you hear the scream and you then react to being in like a "shocked" state (silenced). this is different to fire, where there is obvious travel time from annie and the damage would be dependent on if you felt it or not

of course ultimately the best thing to do with cho is, as expected, give the indicator and the ability graphics a range buff but apply it the same as annies new W, however cho's W would probably travel faster, most likely, so it kind of evens it out in terms of whether people would and should get hit, as opposed to annies W. the priority 1st given to annie was appropriate but depending on how hard it is to change for rito will determine when it comes out

> [{quoted}](name=GigaPube,realm=OCE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=kEAbOY0F,comment-id=000000020001,timestamp=2016-05-04T08:15:11.817+0000)
>
> no, if chogath screams and you're in range at the time of the ability, you should be effected. congrats on flashing out soon after but sound travels pretty fast, especially at close quarters. the silence is supposed to act as an intimidation, you hear the scream and you then react to being in like a "shocked" state (silenced). this is different to fire, where there is obvious travel time from annie and the damage would be dependent on if you felt it or not
> 
> of course ultimately the best thing to do with cho is, as expected, give the indicator and the ability graphics a range buff but apply it the same as annies new W, however cho's W would probably travel faster, most likely, so it kind of evens it out in terms of whether people would and should get hit, as opposed to annies W. the priority 1st given to annie was appropriate but depending on how hard it is to change for rito will determine when it comes out

Flash of light travels faster than sound
900,000 times faster roughly.
sound travels faster than your reaction speed. specially since you don't react until after you hear it.
light and fire arent necesserly the same. Flamethrowers doesnt spit fire at the speed of light. thats what he was trying to say.
....whos talking about light? where the hell did you get light from and how does this have 8 upvotes and mine gets downvoted for justifying my argument properly hahahaha :P

Right then let's revert Darius E now. Literally any animation from a champion will invalidate his E. Even moving to the right side a bit will invalidate Darius E. There is a reason why he got the nerf and every other champion hay shares this characteristics should get it too. Annie ultimate is next in line.

Cho and from memory a few others (Kass, possibly Morde, can't recall off the top of the head if we changed that last year of not). We'll get to them at some point whenever we're in a position to ensure the change doesn't cripple them unintentionally (Cho's half second cast time makes it a much larger change for him than it would be for Annie for example).

pretty sure morde's works as logic intends.

Makes sense though.

Ty for the response Meddler

It's just annoying to pull off a sweet reaction flash play only to be denied

There is a bug I found and confirmed with my friend that went unnoticed after posting in this forum
It is possible for vladimir to die to annie W, Kass W, Morde E, Rumble Q AFTER he uses w and goes to cooldown.

Probably around the same time they'll get rid of her obnoxious point and click Q.


Never.
They mentioned that in the past. It would be a considerable nerf for Cho so they likely won't remove that without some additional changes for him.

It's not as detrimental to his gameplay as Darius' Apprehend, I fear.

He most likely won't get any compensation for losing it.
But, Darius got some significant changes when that was removed, so idk why you are comparing them.

Check what "_detrimental_" means.

What I meant, was Darius had a very hard time doing anything if Apprehend didn't hit, so he had to be compensated.

Cho'Gath still has Q to catch an enemy.
It's not important whether it's as detrimental though, a nerf is a nerf and they said they wouldn't want to just nerf him with that.

> [{quoted}](name=DarkenedAuras,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=kEAbOY0F,comment-id=00000002,timestamp=2016-05-04T01:28:20.783+0000)
>
> So that's just cho'gath left right?
> 
> When do you plan on making this deceptive gameplay flaw gone?

leave my cho alone. he needs to nom on people. ;-;

> [{quoted}](name=DarkenedAuras,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=kEAbOY0F,comment-id=00000002,timestamp=2016-05-04T01:28:20.783+0000)
>
> So that's just cho'gath left right?
> 
> When do you plan on making this deceptive gameplay flaw gone?

Actually no, Kassadin and a couple others too, although I don't think nerfs would be warranted on Kassadin. He's gotten the most nerfs of any champ since release and is actually fine now. He could even use a minor minor buff.
I thought kass W? (which one is it?) worked like makes sense, and I don't know what other champs have abilities like these

Understandable.

Initially I considered it either an intelligence check or a good joke.

Come to think of it, Ahri's Charm change some time ago might had a similar description in the patch notes.

> [{quoted}](name=Vistha Kai,realm=EUNE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=kEAbOY0F,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2016-05-03T21:41:33.977+0000)
>
> Understandable.
> 
> Initially I considered it either an intelligence check or a good joke.
> 
> Come to think of it, Ahri's Charm change some time ago might had a similar description in the patch notes.

The same with old gangplank and his ult.  They changed the duration, numbers of cannonballs and such, each time it was a 'bug', the culmination of all them were a nerf.
What about Darius' pull?  It's infuriating to flash away from that, only to be pulled back because the affected targets were chosen before he actually pulls back his axe.

They already changed that when they reworked him, there's just some lag on the server end between your comp showing your dash and your comp registering you were hit.

Darius activates E as you activate dash
You dash for about .25s and if still in the range, get hit by Darius E
For the (ping*2) time it takes the server to tell your comp you got hit, your comp still continues showing your dash.

Good to know!  Now I can blame my ISP every time Darius kills me!

DARN YOU, COMCAST!
If your ISP is Comcast you should blame them no matter what.
That 15 minute response time tho.

> and should instead be talking about why how we feel it's appropriate to remove some reliability from Annie.

could you elaborate?

Well before this change, if they were in the area of effect when Annie started her W cast, people were stunned even if they moved out of it before the ability actually hit them. 

Compare that to after the change, where people are now able to dodge the stun if they move outside of its AoE between it being cast and the ability actually coming out. So from the Annie player's perspective, there is a decrease in reliability now.
I understand what the change is, I'm more curious why they feel its the appropriate move for annie.

Well the mage update gave her a bit more initiation uptime, as well as some overall minor reliability tweaks to her shield and tibber's damage, so removing some of the reliability that feels unfun to play against seems like a good place to balance that.
"A bit more initiation uptime"? Did I miss something in the Notes? I don't understand which change you're thinking about.
Protobelt gives her a larger threat radius and makes her not totally reliant on flash cool down
Because she is braindead and the old action didn't make sense anyway. She also got buffed.

> Because she is braindead 

That's a pretty dismissive point of view from someone i didn't ask. I asked meddler because i knew he would have something to contribute to the conversation, so if you don't have anything more intelligent to add to the conversation then thank you for your input but i'll just wait for a proper response.

I can throw some cool fancy words in there if that will get you off? But, in simple form, that's exactly the reason.

I think it's pretty damn obvious why they want to remove some reliability from Annie. If you see it, you probably aren't as "intelligent" as you think you are :D

> If you see it, you probably aren't as "intelligent" as you think you are :D

The irony in your grammar amuses me. If you took a minute to think about what you are saying it might be easier to take you seriously.
Ah. You should've elaborated on what you wanted elaborated.

So is there an exact number as to how many seconds the delay will be on the actual "stun" part.
Since now the delay is on cast meaning 0
After this it will be?

I think Repertoir mentioned it was .25s in the PBE thread about Veigar/Annie/Fiddle. Not sure though.

But actually, the stun will take effect at the exact same timing as before. It was stunning people at the end of cast, and it still stun them at end of cast. What has changed is not **when** people are stunned, it's **who** is stunned. Before, everyone who was in the cone at start of cast was then stunned at end of cast. Now, only people still in the cone at end of cast are immediately stunned.

hum, and so if you should be talking about that, why do you feel it's appropriate to remove some reliability? :)

As a side note, why DID you think it was an appropriate behavior before? I can understand if it both picks and affects at cast start, or both at cast end, but one of each seems very strange. One of those quirks that you learn after playing enough games and that are not really a problem once you know them, but still annoying and illogical.

> [{quoted}](name=Meddler,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=kEAbOY0F,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2016-05-03T20:57:00.470+0000)
>
> Apologies, that's a poor choice of wording in the patch notes that shouldn't have been used. Leaving Annie's W so that it picked its targets at cast start and affected them at cast end was a deliberate choice for a long period of time, not a bug. We shouldn't be describing it as one as a result and should instead be talking about why how we feel it's appropriate to remove some reliability from Annie.

Just like Morgana's black shield no longer absorbing Ignite was a 'bug' after years?  And just so happened to hit on the patch of her first skin release.

And wasn't mentioned in the patch notes until the skin buy rush was over.

Yeah, still salty over that #*$&.
Considering Tibbers has now gone from flash-stun to Rampaging Infernal Hell-Bear I say this was a minor change.

> [{quoted}](name=Meddler,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=kEAbOY0F,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2016-05-03T20:57:00.470+0000)

We shouldn't be describing it as one as a result and should instead be talking about why how we feel it's appropriate to remove some reliability from Annie.

So many times, I got killed when playing Vlad while still in my pool cause of that stupid cone

> [{quoted}](name=Meddler,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=kEAbOY0F,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2016-05-03T20:57:00.470+0000)

We shouldn't be describing it as one as a result and should instead be talking about why how we feel it's appropriate to remove some reliability from Annie.

Incompetent company.
#Favoritism
Can you fix all the abilities that were like {{champion:122}} old E next patch?
I got baited by 69. Wp sir.
Blame Rito for their naming.

thx op for the reminder

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=633wGjKF3J4
